Using an alternate header parser
--------------------------------

Define the parser with a pattern and meta keys:

>>> from loggrok.parse import HeaderParser
>>> patt = r'^([a-zA-Z]+) ([a-zA-Z]+) <(\d+)> '
>>> meta = ('petname', 'animal', 'some_number')
>>> parser = HeaderParser(patt, meta)

Parse a header using alternate parser:

>>> from loggrok.log import LogHeader
>>> logheader = LogHeader('kitty cat <1336> ', parser=parser)
>>> print logheader.petname
kitty
>>> print logheader.animal
cat
>>> print logheader.some_number
1336


Or parse first and pass meta into LogHeader:
    
>>> header, meta = parser.parse('kitty cat <1336> ')
>>> from loggrok.log import LogHeader
>>> logheader = LogHeader(header, meta=meta)
>>> print logheader.petname
kitty
>>> print logheader.animal
cat
>>> print logheader.some_number
1336
